bibl.title: Letter from M.A. Delaney to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 18, 1925

div1.p: Delaney congratulates Kean on his review of the Gorgas biography.

div1.head: Letter from M.A. Delaney to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 18, 1925
div1.opener:
STATION HOSPITAL
THE FIELD ARTILLERY SCHOOL
FORT SILL, OKLAHOMA
March 18, 1925.
Colonel J.R. Kean,
The Military Surgeon,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D.C.
My dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
My hat is off to you for doing a real service to the
Medical Corps. I have just read your review of General Gorgas' life and
it is a dignified, calm, and clear recital of facts.

These facts were not known to the profession nor people
at large and in consequence Gorgas has been the whole Medical Corps for
twenty five years. These things should have been told and stressed
years ago. Indeed many of them I did not know, and thought I was
fairly well posted on our own Corps.

I had something to do with his being made a Knight
Commander of the Bath, after it had been turned down once before. Of
course General Goodwin asked me, as Liaison Officer and it was my
duty. I will tell you sometime about it. He also asked me to accom-
pany him on his last trip to Africa and only reached London.

This review is a real one and I sincerely congratulate
you on doing the Corps and profession a genuine service.

Sill has not changed much since you were here. There
is nothing near it and of course no roads. The Army people of course,
as always, are charming and make the Post.

Mrs. DeLaney joins me in best greetings to you and
Mrs. Kean.
